results.headline: Flickers of Trauma
results.summary_short: “Lake Tahoe” is so different from the usual fare that it might have arrived from another galaxy.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Lake Tahoe

results.headline: So Listen, America, to Your Bighearted Jewish Mother
results.summary_short: “The Oprah of her day” is one talking head’s description of the broadcasting pioneer Gertrude Berg in the engrossing documentary “Yoo-Hoo, Mrs. Goldberg.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Yoo-Hoo, Mrs. Goldberg

results.headline: Rites of Passage Through the Rolling Stones and Fallen Civilizations
results.summary_short: “The Vanished Empire” views the collapse of the Soviet Union as an inevitable conflation of the younger generation’s natural impulse to reject the past.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Vanished Empire

results.headline: Music and Musicians Still Echo 35 Years Later
results.summary_short: “Soul Power” is an extravagantly entertaining documentary, assembled by Jeffrey Levy-Hinte from a trove of hundreds of hours of footage.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Soul Power

results.headline: Putting a Bromance to an Erotic Test
results.summary_short: With X-ray vision, “Humpday” sees through its male characters’ macho pretensions to contemplate the underlying forces hard-wired into men’s psyches.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Humpday

results.headline: Hey, Nerd: Look Out, She’s Not Your Type
results.summary_short: If fun is what you’re looking for, you might want to avoid “I Love You, Beth Cooper,” a drab and incoherent teen comedy.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of I Love You, Beth Cooper

results.headline: Teutonic Fashion Plate Flaunts His Umlauts
results.summary_short: “Brüno” offers both succor and sucker bait for liberal-minded viewers who may feel harassed by prevailing cultural sensitivities.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Brüno

results.headline: Somebody in Chile Worships the Disco-Era Travolta
results.summary_short: “Tony Manero” tells the story of a thug who dreams about a fictional fleeting success.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Tony Manero

results.headline: Even Behind Bars, Motherhood Can Be Liberating
results.summary_short: “Lion’s Den” is the Argentine director Pablo Trapero’s sprawling, unpredictable drama about a woman who gives birth in prison while awaiting trial for murder.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Lion's Den

results.headline: Long-Range Forecast: All Hot and Bothered
results.summary_short: If in the end “The Girl From Monaco” is neither a cogent psychological thriller nor an effervescent sex comedy, it does at least have an interesting sense of place.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Girl From Monaco

results.headline: Inside the Nigerian Film Industry
results.summary_short: “Nollywood Babylon” profiles the explosive success of this truly populist cinema.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Nollywood Babylon

results.headline: The Bollywood Sign
results.summary_short: Bollywood casts a proprietary eye on Hollywood in “Kambakkht Ishq.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Kambakkht Ishq

results.headline: The Game of Love, Played With an Unorthodox Rule Book
results.summary_short: The conflicted lovebirds in “I Hate Valentine’s Day” may be in their 30s, but they play the game of romance with the finesse of sixth graders.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of I Hate Valentine's Day

results.headline: Seduction by Machine Gun
results.summary_short: Michael Mann’s “Public Enemies” is a grave and beautiful work of art.

results.headline: Videocam in Hand, a French Filmmaker Sifts Her Memories
results.summary_short: “The Beaches of Agnès” is at once an illustration of the fine art of foraging and an autobiographical portrait.

results.headline: Notes From the Prehistoric Underground
results.summary_short: What? Dawn of the dinosaurs? In the Ice Age? You’ve got to be kidding.

results.headline: Friendships in the Big City, Bent by 9/11
results.summary_short: Kabir Khan’s “New York” looks at America after 9/11 through a Bollywood lens.

results.headline: A Talent-Show Tonic for a War-Weary Land
results.summary_short: In “Afghan Star,” Havana Marking’s engrossing documentary, suspense surrounds a talent competition that becomes a national obsession.

results.headline: Soldiers on a Live Wire Between Peril and Protocol
results.summary_short: If “The Hurt Locker” is not the best action movie of the summer, I’ll blow up my car.

results.headline: Crusty Painter’s Protégé and One Pivotal Summer
results.summary_short: “Local Color” is so well acted that you almost forgive its formulaic structure, treacly score and earnest voice-over narration.
